intro: Echium brachyanthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as coastal cliffs and grasslands. Its flowers are tubular and attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Echium brachyanthum is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
